page.title: 09The role of the vicar
page.content: The vicar has the responsibility for the life and work of the church in the parish. He helps to lead the worship of the congregation in church. He teaches the people the Christian faith and prepares them for confirmation. Also he conducts services of baptism, holy matrimony and burial. He visits the sick and old people in their homes and takes them Holy Communion. He goes to two schools in the parish to take their assemblies and he serves on their governing bodies. People in hospital in Stafford are visited. The vicar helps with various organisations both within and outside the church. The vicar's role in the community is quite important and he represents the church within the community and helps the church to give service to the community. The church is concerned about unemployment and violence.
